headline: Trump’s Smartphone Can’t Be Made in America for $499 by August
summary: When the Trump Organization said it would launch a mobile-phone service, it also said it would sell a $499 T1 Phone beginning in August with some specs that beat the current top iPhone.  A press release said the gold Android phone would be “proudly designed and built in the United States.”  In April, when President Trump unveiled his sweeping tariffs, we investigated what it would take to make an iPhone in the U.S. Supply-chain experts agreed the U.S. would need years and many billions of dollars to establish the factories and skillsets needed to match China’s output.

headline: Alibaba launches new Qwen3 AI models for Apple's MLX architecture
summary: China's tech giant Alibaba has launched new Qwen3 artificial intelligence models for Apple's MLX architecture, Alibaba said in a statement on Monday. The new models would be able to run on a range of Apple devices, including iPhone, iPad, MacBook and Mac, Alibaba said in a post on Wechat.

headline: The Trump family's next venture, a mobile phone company
summary: The Trump family said it is licensing its name to a new mobile phone service, the latest in a string of ventures that have been announced while Donald Trump is in the White House despite ethical concerns that the U.S. president could mold public policy for personal gain.  Eric Trump, one of President Donald Trump’s sons running The Trump Organization, said the new venture called, Trump Mobile, will sell phones that will be built in the U.S., and the phone service will maintain a call center in the country as well.  A $1.5 billion partnership to build golf courses, hotels and real estate projects in Vietnam was approved last month, but the deal was in the works before Trump was elected.

raw.headline: The Trump family's next venture, a mobile phone company
raw.summary: The Trump family said it is licensing its name to a new mobile phone service, the latest in a string of ventures that have been announced while Donald Trump is in the White House despite ethical concerns that the U.S. president could mold public policy for personal gain.  Eric Trump, one of President Donald Trump’s sons running The Trump Organization, said the new venture called, Trump Mobile, will sell phones that will be built in the U.S., and the phone service will maintain a call center in the country as well.  A $1.5 billion partnership to build golf courses, hotels and real estate projects in Vietnam was approved last month, but the deal was in the works before Trump was elected.

headline: The Best Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy With $1,000 Right Now
summary: Three Buffett holdings worth considering now are Apple, Louisiana-Pacific, and Pool Corp.  All three have attractive businesses, and their stocks make great choices for novice investors.  If you are a relatively new investor looking to learn from experienced and successful investors, there's no better place to start than by looking at what Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway is holding in its equity portfolio.

headline: Streetwise: Time to Look Again at Investing in Europe?
summary: A common reader complaint is that their experiments investing in Europe over the years have always proved disappointing, if not disastrous.  It’s easy to see why: From 2007 to the end of last year, MSCI’s European index underperformed the U.S. in 13 out of 17 years, in dollar terms.  An American investor in Europe made just 108% with dividends reinvested, against 485% if they stuck with U.S. stocks.

headline: 1 Unstoppable Stock That Could Join the $1 Trillion Club Alongside Nvidia, Apple, Amazon, Microsoft, and More
summary: The American economy produced nine companies with valuations of over $1 trillion, including powerhouses like Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft.  Oracle could join that exclusive club within the next few years, thanks to soaring demand for its artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure.  Apple then crossed the most exclusive milestone of all in 2018, when it became the world's first $1 trillion company.

headline: My Top 5 AI Stocks to Buy Before the Second Half
summary: AI stocks drove market gains over the past two years, but earlier this year they led declines.  Investors, worried about the potential impact of import tariffs on the economy, avoided growth stocks.  The first half of the year was a turbulent one for stocks in general amid concern President Trump's planned import tariffs would hurt the economy.
